body: Yes, I can reproduce this issue.
I got same issue. Any progress around this issue?

If you are just looking for a workaround you can tell lombok not to generate the ConstructorProperties annotation over constructors. 
`@AllArgsConstructor(suppressConstructorProperties = true)` will prevent the java.beans.ConstructorProperties annotation from being put over the constructors.

okay. it works well for me.

On Tue, Mar 1, 2016, 18:29 logic-1 notifications@github.com wrote:

> If you are just looking for a workaround you can tell lombok not to
> generate the ConstructorProperties annotation over constructors.
> @AllArgsConstructor(suppressConstructorProperties = true) will prevent
> the java.beans.ConstructorProperties annotation from being put over the
> constructors.
> 
> —

> .

okay.
i see.

On Wed, Mar 2, 2016, 04:37 Tatu Saloranta notifications@github.com wrote:

> @tokuhirom https://github.com/tokuhirom Unfortunately no progress; I
> can reproduce the problem, but it is not clear yet whether this even is a
> bug or desired behavior, mostly because of ambiguity regarding
> introspection of constructor parameter names (which may or may not be
> available).
> 
> But I do hope to eventually resolve this, and there is a failing unit test
> to show the problem itself.
> 
> 2.7.2 version still has the issue, for what that is worth.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/1122#issuecomment-190867533
> .

FYI: I added `lombok.anyConstructor.suppressConstructorProperties = true` to `lombok.config` file.
It removes `@ConstructorProperties` from the class, that has @AllArgsConstructor annotation.
I have the same error since I switched to gradle 2.0.0 with databind 2.7.3

issue.title: Add support for @ConstructorProperties

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
[ConstructorProperties](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/beans/ConstructorProperties.html) provide a standard way to communicate constructor properties. Currently, you have to use `JsonCreator` with `JsonProperty` to achieve the same behavior with jackson.

Libraries like lombok generate constructors using the standard annotation, which makes it necessary to manually annotate the constructor when using jackson. There are already libraries that add support for this annotation but I believe it could be added to the main project without problems.

I believe ConstructorProperties is absent on android so it might be necessary to handle that gracefully.

body: Turns out that I think this can be changed for 2.7.4 after all, can fix this.
